subject: Re: Mirroring ISOs
body:
I've always run jigdo-lite against my own mirror.  It provides two things:

1) Proves I can reliably build the ISOs from what I have mirrored locally.
2) Doesn't waste additional bandwidth.

As long as the checksums match what is provided from the official ISO
image master site, I don't see what the difference would be.

Anyone else do this? :)

Will
